metadata.title: CVE-2016-2109 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The asn1_d2i_read_bio function in crypto/asn1/a_d2i_fp.c in the ASN.1 BIOimplementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via ashort invalid encoding.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2109` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.1
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.1').
